physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Bilateral, asymmetric facial palsies (worse on the right), bilateral failure of ocular abduction, bilateral blepharoptosis, high arched but intact hard palate, good masseteric contractions bilaterally, complete absence of pectoralis major and nipple areolar complex on the left, significant axillary hollowing, hypoplasia of left upper limb (particularly forearm and hand), symbrachydactyly with a reasonable thumb including thenar musculature, flexion at the metacarpophalangeal and interphalangeal joints, hypoplastic, biphalangeal, and syndactylized index, middle and ring fingers, active movement at the elbow and shoulder.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At 18 months of age, he underwent release of the 1st and 4th web space syndactyly. He remains a candidate for bilateral facial reanimation.
